page.title: 11Farming in Newton
page.content: Farming in this area has changed over the years from arable to mainly beef or dairy farming.Some farms are almost totally self-sufficient while others rely on seasonal help or sub- contractors.Cattle are bought and sold at Rugby and other nearby markets.One farm has a milking herd of 114 cows; another is in the process of breeding a pedigree herd of 215 Charollar cattle while others deal mainly in beef and sheep.(One farmer,though originally born on a Welsh farm,spent his early life as a boxer,becoming British and Empire Heavyweight champion).All farmers agreed that it was essential to understand livestock and to know the capabilities of their own land.With numerous public footpaths running over their land a plea was made to 'close gates' and keep dogs under control.
